How to Install mrtgutils on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • mrtgutils

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install mrtgutils on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing mrtgutils on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall mrtgutils in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install mrtgutils, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install mrtgutils Using apt

To install mrtgutils in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install mrtgutils using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install mrtgutils

The installation of mrtgutils might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install mrtgutils Using apt-get

To install mrtgutils using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install mrtgutils.

sudo apt-get -y install mrtgutils

Install mrtgutils Using Synaptic

To install mrtgutils using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install mrtgutils on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for mrtgutils. This will display the mrtgutils package in the package window, now to install mrtgutils, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the mrtgutils package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of mrtgutils.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install mrtgutils Using aptitude

To install mrtgutils on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of mrtgutils.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install mrtgutils using the command aptitude install mrtgutils.

sudo aptitude -y install mrtgutils

How to Upgrade mrtgutils on debian

If you want to upgrade the mrtgutils package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade mrtgutils using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade mrtgutils to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade mrtgutils.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade mrtgutils sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade mrtgutils

Upgrade mrtgutils using Aptitude

To upgrade mrtgutils using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade mrtgutils.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade mrtgutils

Upgrade mrtgutils using Synaptic

To upgrade mrtgutils using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for mrtgutils, now right-click mrtgutils, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade mrtgutils just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall mrtgutils on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall mrtgutils from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just mrtgutils, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove mrtgutils

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of mrtgutils

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of mrtgutils you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge mrtgutils

Remove mrtgutils using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall mrtgutils using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for mrtgutils, right-click the mrtgutils package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall mrtgutils click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install mrtgutils on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade mrtgutils using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of mrtgutils then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
